meanings.definition: A previous model or pattern from which other similar things are copied or developed.
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins served as the antetypes for the new architectural designs.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used the antetypes of famous paintings to inspire her students.
meanings.sent3: The antetypes of the past guided the artists in creating futuristic sculptures.
meanings.sent4: Her grandmother's recipes were the antetypes for her own unique dishes.
meanings.sent5: The antetypes of nature can be seen in the intricate patterns of a snowflake.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that serves as a model or example for others to follow.
meanings.sent1: The successful entrepreneur became an antetypes for aspiring business owners.
meanings.sent2: The brave firefighter was seen as an antetypes of heroism in the community.
meanings.sent3: The antetypes of kindness and generosity were evident in her actions.
meanings.sent4: His determination to overcome challenges made him an antetypes for perseverance.
meanings.sent5: The antetypes of leadership can be found in historical figures who inspired change.
